PPE: Which PPE does the parameter belong to
component: component name (used to assign the parameter to a component namelist file)
scale_fact: scaling factor instead of min-max range
default: default value for the parameter in the model version
ndigits: number of digits to consider when sampling i.e. resolution of sampling
input_type: Specifies how the parameter is passed to the model
last_edited: date of the day when the parameter default and ranges was last set
Justification: choice of range,  the reason it needs to be tuned and/or expected effect of tuning.

Logic: Threshold diameter to convert cloud ice particles to snow. Smaller dcs cause less ice in the clouds and lower LWCS. Larger dcs cause more ice in the clouds and larger LWCF.
Justification: ".. the parameter micro_mg_dcs is still important for the LWRE in the tropics. This is not surprising since it has a large impact on cirrus clouds." Eidhammer 2024

Logic: convective parcel temperature perturbation, where a higher value means more buoyant parcels and deeper convection.
Justification: The deep convection parameter that impacts radiation outputs the most is the convective parcel temperature perturbation (zmconv_tiedke_add), and this is especially true in the tropics.

Logic: Tuning parameter for skewness of vertical velocity. Large/positive values tend to be associated with Cu clouds, while small/negative values tend to be associated with Sc clouds. Turning this up decreases the skewness and increases the brightness of clouds.
Increased value strengthens restratifying shallow submesoscale driven overturning, which typically reduces ocean surface boundary layer depth.

parameter description: Efficiency factor for mesoscale eddy diffusivity [-]
Logic: Increased value strengthens overall mesoscale driven diffusivities
The dry surface layer is an insulating layer at the top of the soil, reducing evaporation
Justification: The DSL parameters are poorly constrained, but has a large effect on evaporation and temerature.

parameter description: Fractional soil moist. at which DSL initiates
Slope of the stomatal conductance model.
Soil moisture threshold for drought-induced plant mortality
Logic: Including this as a potential lever on how much the amazon can tolrate low rainfall.
Possible impact on atmospheric coupling & precip.
The standard value used in the model overestimate ice growth. One new value suggested in litterature (0.45)
